[[Image:Replace this image male.svg|thumb]]'''Mark Umbers''' (born [[June 17]], [[1973]]) is an [[England|English]] [[actor]] known for his work in [[theatre]], [[film]]s, and [[television]].
Born in [[Harrogate]], [[Yorkshire]], Umbers was raised in [[Wetherby]]. In 1991, he enrolled at [[Oxford University]] to study Latin and Greek Literature and Philosophy. He appeared in many student [[William Shakespeare|Shakespeare]] productions, as well as in [[George Bernard Shaw]]'s ''[[Pygmalion]]'' in which he played Freddy, a role he would reprise a decade later in ''[[My Fair Lady]]'' at the [[Royal National Theatre]] in London.
Born in [[Harrogate]], [[Yorkshire]], Umbers was raised in [[Wetherby]]. In 1991, he enrolled at [[Oxford University]] to study Latin and Greek Literature and Philosophy. He appeared in many student [[William Shakespeare|Shakespeare]] productions, as well as in [[George Bernard Shaw]]'s ''[[Pygmalion]]'' in which he played Freddy, a role he would reprise a decade later in ''[[My Fair Lady]]'' at the [[Royal National Theatre]] in London.
